net.tonkovich.java

Class Discount

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.tonkovich.java.Discount

  • public class Discount
extends java.lang.Object
    Singleton that parses and holds data pertaining to user input.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double calculate()
      After the behavior, unitPrice, and quantity have been assigned this method will use the assigned behaviors method to calculate the final price.
      static Discount getInstance() 
      void setDiscount(java.util.Scanner scan, java.util.List<DiscountOptions> discounts)
      This method takes in user input, parses it, and assigns the behavior the user wants.
      void setQuantity(java.util.Scanner scan)
      This method takes in user input, parses it, and assigns the quantity of the items the user is trying to calculate.
      void setUnitPrice(java.util.Scanner scan)
      This method takes in user input, parses it, and assigns the unit price for the item the user is trying to calculate.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Discount getInstance()

      • calculate

        public double calculate()
        After the behavior, unitPrice, and quantity have been assigned this method will use the assigned behaviors method to calculate the final price.
        Returns:
        Final price after discount

      • setDiscount

        public void setDiscount(java.util.Scanner scan,
                        java.util.List<DiscountOptions> discounts)
        This method takes in user input, parses it, and assigns the behavior the user wants. If the user enters incorrect input the method will recurse and ask the user again indefinitely until correct input is entered.
        Parameters:
        scan - Scanner object to get user input
        discounts - List of discount options

      • setUnitPrice

        public void setUnitPrice(java.util.Scanner scan)
        This method takes in user input, parses it, and assigns the unit price for the item the user is trying to calculate. If the user inputs a price incorrectly the method will recurse indefinitely until correct input is entered.
        Parameters:
        scan - Scanner object to get user input

      • setQuantity

        public void setQuantity(java.util.Scanner scan)
        This method takes in user input, parses it, and assigns the quantity of the items the user is trying to calculate. If the user inputs a quantity incorrectly the method will recurse indefinitely until correct input is entered.
        Parameters:
        scan - Scanner object to get user input

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
